definitions: create text or symbols on a surface using a pen or similar tool
compose or create music literature or other artistic works
record or store data information or code in a system
examples: Please write your name clearly on the application form
She writes in her journal every night before bed
Mozart could write entire symphonies in his head first
He writes beautiful poetry about nature and love
The program writes data to the hard drive automatically
Make sure to write the changes to the database

definitions: carry or transport someone or something to a particular place
cause something to happen or come into a particular state
persuade or convince someone to come somewhere or do something
examples: Don't forget to bring your passport to the airport
Could you bring me a glass of water please
This news will bring joy to many people worldwide
The new policy brought significant changes to our company
I'll try to bring my sister to the party tonight
What brings you to this part of town today

definitions: change position or go from one place to another
change one's place of residence or location permanently
affect someone emotionally or cause strong feelings
examples: Please move your car so others can park here
The cat moved silently through the tall grass
We're moving to a bigger house next month finally
They moved from Japan to Canada last year
The speech moved everyone in the audience to tears
Your kindness really moves me thank you so much

definitions: express that something is necessary obligatory or very important
express strong probability or logical certainty about something
something that is absolutely necessary or required
examples: You must wear a seatbelt while driving the car
Students must complete all assignments to pass the course
She must be at home the lights are on
That must have been difficult for you to handle
Visiting Paris is a must for any art lover
This book is a must-read for history students everywhere

definitions: start doing something or cause something to start happening
come into existence or start to occur at a particular time
start speaking or start to say something
examples: Let's begin the meeting with a brief introduction please
She began learning Spanish at age forty last year
The problems began when the new manager arrived here
Spring begins in March in the northern hemisphere regions
He began to explain but was quickly interrupted midsentence
May I begin by thanking everyone for coming today

definitions: feel deep affection attachment or care for someone or something
enjoy or like something very much or find great pleasure in
a score of zero in tennis
examples: I love my family more than words can express
She loves him despite all his faults and mistakes
I absolutely love chocolate ice cream on hot days
He loves playing video games with his friends online
The score is forty-love in favor of Serena Williams
She won the first set six games to love

definitions: grasp carry or support something with one's hands or arms
contain have capacity for or be able to accommodate something
organize conduct or be the host of an event or meeting
examples: Hold my hand while we cross the busy street
Can you hold this bag while I unlock the door
This bottle holds exactly one liter of water inside
The stadium holds fifty thousand people when completely full
We'll hold the conference in the main auditorium downtown
They hold a charity auction every year in December

definitions: look at and understand written or printed words or symbols
interpret or understand the meaning of signs signals or situations
study a particular subject at a university or college
examples: I read the newspaper every morning with my coffee
Can you read this handwriting it's very messy looking
She can read people's emotions from their facial expressions
The pilot reads the instruments to check flight status
He's reading law at Oxford University this year currently
She read chemistry before switching to medicine last semester

definitions: cease moving or come to an end or halt
prevent something from happening or continuing to happen
make a brief visit or pause at a place
examples: Stop the car at the red traffic light ahead
The rain finally stopped after three days of storms
We must stop pollution from destroying our planet completely
Nothing can stop her from achieving her dreams now
Let's stop at the store on our way home
We stopped by Sarah's house to say hello yesterday

definitions: give money that is due for work goods or services
give attention regard or respect to someone or something
be profitable or worthwhile in terms of results or benefits
examples: I need to pay the rent by Friday afternoon
Did you pay for the groceries with cash today
Please pay attention to the safety instructions being given
You should pay more respect to your elders always
Crime doesn't pay in the long run trust me
All that hard work will pay off eventually someday

definitions: supply or give something that is needed or wanted
make something available for use or make provision for
stipulate or state something in a law or agreement
examples: The hotel provides towels and toiletries for all guests
Parents provide food and shelter for their children daily
The library provides free internet access to everyone here
We'll provide transportation to and from the airport
The contract provides that payment is due monthly
The law provides for equal treatment of all citizens

definitions: no longer have something because it has been taken or misplaced
be defeated or fail to win in a competition or conflict
become unable to find one's way or maintain control
examples: I always lose my keys when I'm in a hurry
Don't lose this receipt you'll need it later
Our team lost the championship game by one point
She hates to lose at anything even board games
We got lost in the forest for several hours
He's losing his ability to remember recent events clearly

definitions: comprehend the meaning significance or nature of something
be sympathetically aware of someone's feelings or situation
infer assume or interpret something in a particular way
examples: I don't understand this math problem at all honestly
Do you understand the instructions I gave you earlier
I understand how difficult this must be for you
She understands the challenges of being a single parent
I understand you're planning to move to Australia soon
We understand that the meeting has been cancelled today

definitions: stay in a place until something happens or someone arrives
delay action or postpone something until a later time
serve food or drinks to customers in a restaurant
examples: Wait here while I go get the car please
We waited two hours for the doctor to arrive
Let's wait until tomorrow to make a final decision
Don't wait too long to apply for that job
She waits tables at a local diner on weekends
He waited tables to pay for college tuition expenses

definitions: encounter or be introduced to someone for the first time
satisfy or fulfill requirements conditions or standards
come together or assemble at a particular place or time
examples: I'd like you to meet my sister from California
We first met at a conference five years ago
Does this proposal meet all the necessary requirements completely
The product meets the highest quality standards in industry
Let's meet at the coffee shop at three o'clock
The two rivers meet just south of the city

definitions: express gratitude appreciation or acknowledgment to someone
hold someone responsible for something usually ironically
examples: Thank you for helping me with my homework yesterday
I want to thank everyone who supported this project
I have you to thank for this mess obviously
We can thank global warming for these strange weather patterns

definitions: make or become different in some way
replace something with something else or exchange
money in coins or smaller bills given back after payment
examples: We need to change our approach to this problem
The weather can change quickly in the mountains here
I need to change my shirt before the meeting
Could you change the channel to the news please
Do you have change for a twenty dollar bill
Keep the change as a tip for good service

definitions: look at or observe attentively over a period of time
keep under careful observation or guard something
a small timepiece worn on the wrist
examples: Let's watch a movie together tonight after dinner
I love to watch the sunset from this hilltop
Can you watch my bag while I use the restroom
The security guard watches the entrance all night long
My watch stopped working so I was late today
She got a beautiful gold watch for her birthday

definitions: be in a position with one's weight on one's buttocks
be located or positioned in a particular place
take an examination or serve on a committee
examples: Please sit down and make yourself comfortable here today
The cat likes to sit by the window all day
The house sits on top of a small hill overlooking town
The vase sits perfectly on that shelf don't move it
She'll sit for her final exams next week nervously
He sits on the board of directors for three companies

definitions: bring something into existence that did not exist before
cause something to happen or bring about a particular situation
produce works of art literature music or other creative content
examples: Scientists are trying to create artificial intelligence systems
God created the universe according to many religious beliefs
The new policy will create more jobs in rural areas
His comments created quite a controversy in the media
She creates beautiful paintings inspired by nature and landscapes
The chef created a special menu for the event

definitions: gain knowledge or skills through study experience or teaching
become aware of something through information or observation
teach someone a lesson through punishment or experience
examples: Children learn to read in elementary school typically
I'm learning French through an online language app
I just learned that she's moving to another city
We learned of his death from the morning newspaper
That'll learn you not to touch the hot stove
Maybe this experience will learn him some humility finally

definitions: cause the death of a living thing
put an end to or destroy something completely
overwhelm with strong emotion or cause extreme discomfort
examples: The hunter killed a deer for food last weekend
Smoking kills thousands of people every year sadly
This new technology could kill traditional broadcasting methods entirely
Don't kill my dreams with your negative attitude please
These shoes are killing my feet I need new ones
You're killing me with these terrible jokes stop please

definitions: contain or have as a part of a whole
make someone or something part of a group or collection
examples: The price includes breakfast and dinner at the hotel
The book includes chapters on history and culture
Please include me in your weekend plans if possible
We should include everyone in the decision-making process here

definitions: be in an upright position on one's feet
tolerate endure or put up with something unpleasant
remain valid or unchanged in a particular state
examples: Please stand up when the judge enters the courtroom
The statue has stood there for over hundred years
I can't stand the noise from the construction site
How can you stand working in such cold conditions
My offer still stands if you change your mind
The record stands at fifty goals in one season

definitions: go or come after someone or something in space or time
obey comply with or act according to rules or instructions
understand the logic or meaning of something
examples: The dog follows me everywhere I go at home
Please follow the signs to the emergency exit carefully
Students must follow school rules at all times here
Follow the recipe exactly for best results every time
I don't follow your reasoning can you explain again
Do you follow what I'm trying to say here

definitions: recall or bring back to mind something from the past
keep something in mind or not forget to do something
commemorate or honor the memory of someone or something
examples: I can't remember where I put my glasses yesterday
Do you remember our first day of school together
Remember to lock the door when you leave tonight
Please remember to bring your ID card tomorrow morning
We gather here to remember those who died serving
This monument remembers the victims of the tragedy forever

definitions: talk or say words aloud to communicate
give a formal speech or address to an audience
be able to communicate in a particular language
examples: Please speak clearly into the microphone when presenting
She spoke softly so as not to wake the baby
The president will speak at the ceremony tomorrow evening
He was invited to speak at the conference next month
Do you speak Spanish fluently or just a little
My grandmother speaks five languages including Mandarin Chinese

definitions: put place or fix something in a particular position
establish fix or determine something such as rules or standards
a collection or group of things that belong together
examples: Set the vase carefully on the table please now
The sun sets in the west every evening naturally
We need to set some ground rules for this project
The committee will set the date for the meeting
I bought a new set of dishes for the kitchen
She owns the complete set of Harry Potter books

definitions: give permission for someone to do something or something to happen
make it possible for something to happen or exist
admit or acknowledge the truth or existence of something
examples: My parents don't allow me to stay out late
Smoking is not allowed inside the building at all
This software allows users to edit photos easily online
The new bridge allows faster travel between the cities
I allow that I may have been wrong earlier
You must allow that he has a valid point there

definitions: be successful or victorious in a contest or competition
obtain or achieve something through effort or competition
gain the support favor or agreement of someone
examples: Our team won the championship game last night amazingly
She won first prize in the art competition yesterday
He won a scholarship to study at Harvard University
You could win a trip to Hawaii in this contest
The candidate needs to win voters in swing states
Her charm won the hearts of everyone she met

definitions: guide direct or be in charge of others or activities
be ahead or in first place in a competition
result in or bring about a particular consequence
examples: She will lead the team on this new project
The guide led us through the dense forest safely
Our team is leading by ten points at halftime
She leads the race by several seconds right now
Poor diet can lead to serious health problems eventually
This road leads directly to the city center downtown

definitions: persist in an activity or process without stopping
resume an activity or process after a pause or interruption
extend or cause to extend in a particular direction
examples: Please continue reading from where we stopped yesterday
The rain continued throughout the entire night without stopping
We'll continue this discussion after lunch break today
The show will continue after these commercial messages
The path continues through the woods for several miles
This tradition continues from generation to generation in families

definitions: pay out money to buy goods or services
pass time in a particular way or place
use up energy resources or effort on something
examples: I spent fifty dollars on groceries yesterday afternoon
Don't spend all your money in one place foolishly
We spent the weekend at the beach relaxing completely
How do you spend your free time these days
Don't spend all your energy on one task alone
She spent considerable effort organizing the event successfully

definitions: remain in the same place and not move away
reside temporarily as a guest or visitor somewhere
continue to be in a particular state or condition
examples: Stay here while I go check what's happening outside
The dog was trained to stay when commanded firmly
We're staying at a hotel near the beach tonight
How long will you stay in Paris this time
Please stay calm during the emergency evacuation procedure
The weather should stay sunny all week long hopefully

definitions: combine numbers or amounts to calculate a total sum
include or put something extra with something else
say something as an additional comment or afterthought
examples: Add these numbers together to get the total cost
If you add five and three you get eight
Add some salt to the soup for better flavor
Should we add another chair to the table tonight
I'd like to add that everyone did great work
She added that the meeting was moved to Tuesday

definitions: stop living and cease all biological functions permanently
cease to exist function or be used gradually
want something intensely or feel a strong desire
examples: My grandfather died peacefully in his sleep last night
Many soldiers died defending their country during the war
This tradition is dying out in modern society unfortunately
My phone battery died in the middle of the call
I'm dying to know what happened at the meeting
She's dying for a cup of coffee this morning

definitions: obtain something in exchange for payment of money
obtain something through sacrifice effort or hardship
believe accept or be convinced by something
examples: I need to buy milk at the grocery store
She bought a new car with her savings yesterday
Their freedom was bought with many lives lost tragically
Success cannot be bought it must be earned honestly
I don't buy his excuse for being late again
The jury didn't buy the defendant's story at all

definitions: cause something or someone to go to a particular destination
transmit a message signal or communication to someone
cause someone to experience a particular emotion or reaction
examples: Please send this package to my office address tomorrow
They sent their children to private school this year
I'll send you an email with all the details later
Can you send me that photo from last night
That song always sends shivers down my spine instantly
His performance sent the audience into raptures of delight

definitions: move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down feet
accompany someone on foot or help them walk somewhere
follow a particular path route or way of life
examples: I walk to work every day for exercise benefits
The baby just learned to walk last week finally
I'll walk you to your car for safety tonight
The nurse walked the patient down the hospital corridor
You must walk the path of righteousness always faithfully
She chose to walk a different path in life

definitions: increase in size number strength or quality over time
cultivate plants by tending them until they mature
develop mature or come to be gradually over time
examples: Children grow so quickly in their first years
The city's population continues to grow every year steadily
We grow tomatoes in our backyard garden every summer
My grandfather used to grow wheat on his farm
She's grown more confident since starting her new job
Their friendship grew stronger over the years together

definitions: move something so it is no longer closed or blocked
make something accessible available or ready for business
begin start or launch something new
examples: Please open the window for some fresh air now
She slowly opened the mysterious old wooden box carefully
The store opens at nine o'clock every morning promptly
We need to open this road to public traffic soon
The conference will open with a keynote speech tomorrow
They plan to open a new restaurant next month

definitions: think carefully about something before making a decision
regard someone or something as having a particular quality
take something into account when making a judgment
examples: Please consider my proposal before making your final decision
We're considering moving to a warmer climate next year
I consider her to be my best friend always
Many consider this restaurant the best in town
You must consider all factors before investing money anywhere
The judge will consider your previous good behavior carefully

definitions: want something to happen and think it is possible
a feeling of expectation and desire for something
place confidence or trust in someone or something
examples: I hope you have a wonderful birthday celebration tomorrow
We hope to visit Japan next year if possible
There's still hope for finding the missing hikers alive
Don't lose hope things will get better soon enough
We hope in the goodness of humanity despite everything
They hope in God for strength during difficult times

definitions: present something for someone to accept or reject
express willingness to do or give something
attempt try or make an effort to do something
examples: They offered me a job at their company yesterday
Can I offer you something to drink right now
She offered to help with the moving process tomorrow
He offered his seat to the elderly woman kindly
I'll offer a suggestion if you don't mind listening
The defendant offered no resistance during the arrest yesterday

definitions: construct something by putting parts or materials together
develop or increase something gradually over time
base or establish something on a particular foundation
examples: They plan to build a new school next year
Birds build nests to protect their eggs safely
You need to build trust in any relationship slowly
She's building a successful career in medicine steadily
We must build our future on solid principles always
The theory builds on previous research findings significantly

definitions: think or believe that something will happen or is likely
consider it appropriate or required that something happen
be pregnant with a child
examples: I expect the package to arrive tomorrow afternoon probably
We didn't expect such a large crowd at the event
Students are expected to complete assignments on time always
I expect better behavior from you in the future
She's expecting her first baby in June this year
They're expecting twins which is very exciting for them

definitions: move downward typically rapidly and without control
decrease in amount extent or intensity
occur at a particular time or come under a category
examples: Be careful not to fall on the icy sidewalk
The leaves fall from trees in autumn naturally
Stock prices fell sharply after the announcement yesterday
Temperature will fall below freezing tonight be prepared
My birthday falls on a Saturday this year luckily
This case falls under federal jurisdiction not state

definitions: become visible or come into sight where not seen before
give the impression of being or doing something
make a formal appearance or arrive somewhere
examples: Stars appear in the sky after sunset each night
A figure appeared in the doorway suddenly without warning
She appears to be happy with her new job
It appears that we've made a mistake somewhere here
The actor will appear on stage at eight tonight
She appeared in court to testify yesterday morning

definitions: work for or provide services to someone or organization
provide food or drinks to people especially in restaurant
be useful for or fulfill a particular purpose or function
examples: He served in the military for twenty years proudly
She serves on the board of several charities actively
The waiter will serve dinner at seven o'clock tonight
This restaurant serves excellent Italian food every day
This tool serves multiple purposes in the workshop effectively
The old building still serves its original purpose well

definitions: separate into pieces or fragments suddenly or violently
interrupt the continuity flow or uniformity of something
fail to observe or follow a law rule or agreement
examples: Don't break the glass it's very expensive crystal
The rope broke under the heavy weight suddenly
Let's break for lunch and continue later today
Sorry to break your concentration with this interruption
He was arrested for breaking the speed limit repeatedly
Don't break your promise to help me tomorrow
